intro: Diplycosia scabrida, commonly known as the rough diplycosia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
